Package com.shiroyama.chess2.screens

package com.shiroyama.chess2.screens
The com.shiroyama.chess2.screens package provides screen management classes for the Chess2 game. This package contains screen implementations that handle different game states, including the main menu, game board, combat arena, settings, and scoreboard. Each screen manages its own UI elements, user input, and rendering logic.

Key components include:

  • MenuScreen - The main menu interface providing options to start a game, access settings, or exit
  • GameScreen - Manages the chess board display, piece movement, and transitions to combat
  • ArenaScreen - Handles the combat system where pieces battle with projectiles and health points
  • SettingsScreen - Provides interface for configuring game options, piece stats, and display settings
  • ScoreBoardScreen - Displays game statistics including move counts and captured pieces

The screens package uses LibGDX's screen management system to handle transitions between different game states while maintaining proper resource management.
